required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Clinical Implication of the Tunable Crack Sensor
clinical_study.official_title: Development of Diagnosis Algorism for Paroxysmal Arrhythmia Using Ultra-thin Resistive Membrane: a Pilot Study

brief_summary.textblock: [Development of diagnosis algorism for paroxysmal arrhythmia using ultra-thin resistive membrane: a pilot study] Comparison of blood pressure via tunable crack sensor and invasive pressure wire

detailed_description.textblock: To develop a diagnosis algorism for paroxysmal arrhythmia using ultra-thin resistive membrane, we will compare the blood pressure measured via a tunable crack sensor and that measured by a invasive pressure wire

primary_outcome.measure: Blood pressure monitoring using tunable crack sensor
primary_outcome.description: Systolic blood pressure and diastolic blood pressure by using tunable crack sensor

intervention.description: blood pressure monitoring via crack sensor

study_pop.textblock: A case of suspected coronary artery disease for the purpose of coronary angiography

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
A case of suspected coronary artery disease at Seoul National University Hospital for the purpose of coronary angiography
- At least 19 years old
- If he/she hears enough explanation about clinical research and intends to participate in clinical research himself
Exclusion Criteria:
- Under 19 years old
- Refusal to participate in clinical studies
- If the cognitive function is weak enough not to understand the explanation of the clinical study and to make voluntary decisions accordingly

reference.citation: Kang D, Pikhitsa PV, Choi YW, Lee C, Shin SS, Piao L, Park B, Suh KY, Kim TI, Choi M. Ultrasensitive mechanical crack-based sensor inspired by the spider sensory system. Nature. 2014 Dec 11;516(7530):222-6. doi: 10.1038/nature14002.
